description:
There was once a Holy Grail War waged by Mages and Heroic Spirits in a town of Fuyuki. However, one Mage took advantage of the chaos of World War II to steal a Holy Grail. Several decades have passed, and the Yggdmillennia family, who took upon the Holy Grail as its symbol, defected from the Mages' Association. Furious, the Association sent forces to deal with the Yggdmillennia, but were defeated. With the Holy Grail system changed, war at an unprecedented scale breaks out.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Spearplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of spears in combat.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Femboy
tags.description: Features a boy who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of girls.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Boys' Love
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two males, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Bondage
tags.description: Features BDSM, with or without the use of accessories.

tags.name: Femdom
tags.description: Female Dominance. Features sexual acts with a woman in a dominant position.

node.description: [Website](http://higashide-y.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Higashide_Yu)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hagitcho)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Rx6w9YmxY0zly5A)

Originally an animator.
[Website](http://higashide-y.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Higashide_Yu)

__Graduated:__ Kunitachi College of Music (Department of Composition)

[Artist Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/masaruyokoyama) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/masaruyokoyama)

**Yokoyama Masaru** is a Japanese composer, arranger, keyboardist and programmer affiliated with Miracle Bus.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yamada_uk) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/22HS_drill/) Originating from [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/). Works outside anime: - Melty Blood: Type Lumina (Video Game, 2021) (Cut-in Animation Character Design, Animation Director, Key Animation)
[Twitter](https://x.com/tegitallabokaz)

__[The BAMBOO BROOM (Blog)](http://www.remus.dti.ne.jp/~takeucto/)__

A Japanese author best known for writing the visual novels Tsukihime and Fate/stay night. Renowned for a unique style of storytelling and prose, Nasu is amongst the most prominent visual novelists in Japan. 

Together with high school classmate and friend, [Takeuchi Takashi](https://anilist.co/staff/99054/Takashi-Takeuchi), Nasu formed [TYPE-MOON](https://anilist.co/staff/97582) in 2000, originally as a doujin group to create the visual novel Tsukihime. It soon gained immense popularity, much of which is attributed to Nasu's unique style of storytelling. A sequel to Tsukihime, Kagetsu Tohya, was released on August 2001. 

54563 Kinokonasu is named after him
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岩浪美和) | [Twitter](https://x.com/i/user/169097071)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/shio_nakaji)

[Homepage](egoist-inori.jp) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCchlf66z1NueAv8xY117Lmw) | [Twitter | X](twitter.com/EGOIST_2039) | [Facebook](facebook.com/egoist2039) | [Instagram](instagram.com/egoist_2039)

EGOIST was a fictional band that was created for the anime Guilty Crown.
In August 2023, it was announced that EGOIST would disband after two final concerts.

__Members:__
• Vocals: Inori Yuzuriha ([Former known as chelly - new Stage Name: Reche](https://anilist.co/staff/147835/Chelly))
• Composer/Lyricist/Producer: [ryo](https://anilist.co/staff/109941/ryo) ([supercell](https://anilist.co/staff/103913/supercell))

[Website](https://www.garnidelia.com) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCAYfguaShVaNDU561_jJoOQ) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/garnidelia)

__Members:__ female vocalist [MARiA](https://anilist.co/staff/102307/Mai-Mizuhashi) (Mai Mizuhashi), composer [toku](https://anilist.co/staff/160034/Yoshinori-Abe) (Abe Yoshinori)

The duo first collaborated on the song "Color," which was used as the opening theme to the 2010 anime _Freezing_. The name of their unit came from the French phrase "Le Palais Garnier de Maria" (Maria's Opera), and the asteroid Cordelia, which was discovered in 1978, the year of Toku's birth.

In 2014, they made their debut under major record label Defstar Records with the single "ambiguous," which was released on March 5, 2014. Its title track was used as the second opening theme to the 2013 anime _Kill la Kill_.

[Website](http://www.lxixsxa.com/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/lxixsxa/) | [Profile (Anison)](http://anison.info/data/person/29206.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/LiSA_OLiVE) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/xlisa_olivex/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/lisaSMEJ) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/lxixsxa.jp) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA_(Japanese_musician,_born_1987)) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA)

LiSA is a Japanese singer, songwriter and lyricist from Seki, Gifu. LiSA started her own band while in high school to catch a growing wave of punk rock. In 2008, she moved to Tokyo in order to further her musical career. The name "LiSA" stands for "Love is Same All" or "LiVE is Smile Always."

She announced her marriage to voice actor and singer [Tatsuhisa Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95735/Tatsuhisa-Suzuki) on January 22, 2020.
5th Anisong Grand Prix Finalist with Konomi Suzuki. As Asuka Ookura, she performed Sakurasou no Pet na Kanojo ED2 "Prime Number" on February 2013.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mayuge1017)

A Tokyo Zoukei University graduate, he's one of the leading digital animators in the industry, with good character animation and catchy effects.

He is a "follower" of [Tatsuya Yoshihara](https://anilist.co/staff/112047/). In his university days, he was in the same circle as [Ryuu Nakayama](https://anilist.co/staff/133512/). They still have a good relationship and work with each other a lot. 

He is also a good friend of [Takahito Sakazume](https://anilist.co/staff/131945/), the two working often as a "two man production team."

Enokido is mainly known for his work on the Fate franchise, being both the action director for [Fate/Apocrypha](https://anilist.co/anime/98035/) and having directed the majority of the [Fate/Grand Order Commercials](https://anilist.co/anime/101184/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tk_mogi)

Color designer who works frequently with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bahijd) | [Tumblr](http://bahijd.tumblr.com/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/bahijd)

Freelance animator from Austria who gained attraction on the internet thanks to his gif animations, which then served as a stepping stone for him joining the industry. Made his proper debut on [Shinichirou Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/97009/)'s adaptation of [Kids on the Slope](https://anilist.co/anime/12531/). His cuts are often heavily layered, exploiting the unique potential of digital processing.

**Notable works outside anime:**
- Skullgirls (Video Game, 2012) (Character and Effects Animation)
- Carpainter - Digital Harakiri (Music Album, 2015) (Cover Illustration)
- Death Stranding (Video Game, 2019) (Concept Art)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ebi_hide)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/118328356)

Previously affiliated with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures), he is now affiliated with [CygamesPictures](https://anilist.co/studio/6182/CygamesPictures).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hakuoishii)

Trilingual, speaking fluent Taiwanese, Japanese and English. He graduated from Tokyo Designer College.

Initially gained recognition by directing [My Hero Academia](https://anilist.co/anime/21459/My-Hero-Academia/)'s First Season action finale, where he displayed many of the characteristics he would refine later. A certain penchant for action storyboarding and climax episodes involving his acquaintances among some of the most talented digital animators in the industry.

This style was consolidated on [Fate/Apocrypha](https://anilist.co/anime/98035/FateApocrypha/)  Ep. 22 and later on [Mob Psycho II](https://anilist.co/anime/101338/Mob-Psycho-100-II/) Ep. 5.
